alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Castle Country; Central Mountains; San Rafael Swell; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Upper Sevier River Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 6:17PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT WESTERN GARFIELD...PIUTE...WESTERN WAYNE...WESTERN EMERY...SOUTHEASTERN SEVIER AND NORTHWESTERN KANE COUNTIES... At 616 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 9 miles east of Marysvale to Bryce Canyon National Park...and moving northeast at 65 mph. Locations impacted include... Escalante, Junction, Capitol Reef National Park, Loa, Bicknell, Koosharem, Boulder, Torrey, Antimony, Bryce Canyon National Park, Teasdale, Tropic, Lyman, Kingston, Cannonville, Fremont Junction, Fish Lake, Greenwich, Burrville and Angle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 82 and 95. Utah Route 10 between mile markers 0 and 7. Utah Route 12 between mile markers 11 and 27, between mile markers 31 and 33, between mile markers 41 and 61, between mile markers 78 and 100, and between mile markers 103 and 122. Utah Route 24 between mile markers 27 and 75. * winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this squall. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.
